page.title: 02A Farmer's Day.
page.content:
Mr. Schofield of North Hawkwell Farm gets up in the morning at half past seven. In the summer he looks at his sheep and then he has his breakfast. Then he sees the cows and does his silage or hay making. After that he has dinner and goes and does his silage or hay again.
In the winter Mr. Schofield gets up at half past seven and feeds his sheep, has his breakfast and feeds his cows and does odd jobs around the farm like hedging for example. He has his dinner and then carries on with the odd jobs. He feeds his cows and sheep again at eight o'clock.
